content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Three articles covering distinct leave policy types: probation restrictions, days in lieu, and unpaid leave. Each requires navigating Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies and configuring specific policy parameters. Consolidated into single cluster as they share the same admin workflow and configuration interface.

Two articles on leave encashment configuration (one for end-of-service setup, one for calculation mechanics) enriched by PRD on unpaid leave deductions. Articles cover Settings > Payroll > End of Service configuration; PRD adds automation context for deduction creation and payroll integration. Consolidated as they address the same admin workflow with overlapping configuration steps.

Single article on line manager assignment for leave approvals. Covers role management, reporting line setup, and bulk upload workflows. Distinct from policy configuration as it focuses on approval hierarchy rather than policy rules.

Single article on modifying public holidays and triggering automatic leave day recalculation. Covers Settings > Company > Holiday Calendars workflow. Distinct cluster as it addresses holiday management rather than leave policy or request workflows.

Single article on recording daily tasks and hours via Timesheets. Covers both employee task creation and manager team view. Distinct from leave management as it addresses time tracking rather than time-off policies.
Consolidated articles on managing, approving, rejecting, and editing leave requests across web and mobile platforms. PRD adds tracking and reporting context for unpaid leave requests.

content_clusters.topic: Payroll Integration and Unpaid Leave Processing
content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Article on closing payroll with carried-forward unpaid amounts enriched by PRD specifications on automated deduction creation, multi-month splitting, and payroll processor notifications.
PRD-only cluster covering online doctor integration for sick leave certificates. No article coverage in this batch; represents emerging feature.
Grouped tickets where data is lost or unrecoverable: employee reassignment erasing balances, deleted attachments with no recovery mechanism.
KSA-specific sick leave accrual requirements not natively supported; system defaults do not meet local regulatory mandates.
Grouped tickets where audit trails, partial paid leave tracking, and unpaid leave reporting are missing or incomplete in templates and user interfaces.
Grouped tickets addressing lack of flexible policy ordering and policy-specific disclaimer customization in employee views.
Grouped tickets where notification controls lack granularity, salary configuration reminders are missing, and leave expiry notification periods are non-configurable.
Grouped tickets indicating lack of comprehensive unpaid leave request workflow with integrated payroll deduction tracking and complex leave scenario handling.

Grouped tickets describing lack of real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic deduction linking and recalculation when public holidays are added retroactively.

Grouped tickets describing compliance gaps with UAE and KSA labor law requirements (maternity/sick leave proration, public holiday compensation, EOS calculation rules). Includes informational ticket about implemented compliance feature.
Grouped tickets describing lack of clear documentation on carry-over behavior and missing audit trail for policy modifications. Both require backend investigation or lack user-accessible visibility.
Single ticket describing inability to exclude specific leave periods from job tenure calculations, preventing accurate representation of complex employment scenarios.

product_context.title: Online doctor - Sick Leave Certificates - Opportunity assessment
product_context.why_built: Enable employees to obtain Sick Leave Certificates (SLCs) through online doctor consultations instead of 2-3 hour hospital visits. For HR admins, provide centralized SLC tracking and storage to eliminate the mess of collecting certificates from multiple sources (email, messengers, physical) in different formats. Customers receive 250-1000 SLCs monthly - integrating this with Time-Off module increases platform usage and stickiness. Immediate reach ~10,000 employees (80% of WLP clients).
key_design_decisions: SLC integration triggered when employee submits sick leave request
Employee prompted to book online consultation through platform
AED 50 consultation fee charged via Checkout.com payment gateway
DHA issues official SLC through HAH platform
SLC automatically shared with employer via centralized platform storage
Admin can view pending and historical SLCs for payroll/audit purposes
Payment (AED 50) collected via Checkout.com before consultation
Doctor determines SLC eligibility during video consultation
HR admins have centralized SLC storage and tracking
Historical SLCs accessible for payroll or audit purposes

product_context.title: PRD: Unpaid leave deductions
product_context.why_built: Automate unpaid leave deductions by integrating Time Off module with Payroll module. Eliminates manual data transfer between modules when employees take unpaid leave. Automatically calculates and applies salary deductions based on approved unpaid leave requests, reducing administrative burden and improving accuracy.
key_design_decisions: Upon full leave approval, system automatically creates payroll deduction
Deduction appears in payroll adjustments with calculated amount
Multi-month leave creates separate deductions per calendar month for accurate payroll processing
Deductions are non-editable to maintain data consistency
Payroll processor receives email notification for each deduction
Closed payroll months cannot receive new deductions — handled via email notification
Daily pay calculation uses formula: Salary Amount / Total days (calendar or working based on policy)
Deductions are created automatically upon full leave approval, not manually by payroll processor
Deductions are non-editable once created - users must adjust leave request to recalculate
Payroll processor receives email notification when deductions are created or scheduled for future months

product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment: Unpaid Leave requests
product_context.why_built: Enable employers to track unpaid leave requests and understand salary deductions associated with unpaid leave for each employee per month. Provide visibility into unpaid leave impact on payroll calculations. Supports compliance and financial planning by centralizing unpaid leave data.
key_design_decisions: Unpaid leave requests tracked separately from paid leave in Time Off module
Manager/HR approval required before deduction is calculated
System automatically calculates salary deduction upon approval
HR can view overview of unpaid leave deductions per employee per month
Reports available for unpaid leave analytics across organization
Integration with payroll module for automatic deduction processing
Unpaid leave requests follow same approval workflow as paid leave
System automatically tracks approved unpaid leave days and calculates deductions

detected_integrations.description: Leave policies and unpaid leave requests trigger automatic deduction creation in payroll. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on salary configuration (Basic + Allowances) and applied to monthly payroll runs. Multi-month leave creates split deductions across relevant payroll months.

Probation dates stored in employee work profiles determine leave request restrictions. Reporting lines ('Reports to' field) define leave approval hierarchy. Salary configuration in employee records used for unpaid leave deduction calculations.

Core integration across all leave workflows. Leave policies, leave types, leave balances, and leave request approvals are managed through this system. Holiday calendar modifications trigger automatic leave recalculation.
Days in Lieu policy configuration stored in Attendance module. Extra hours tracking integrated with time-off management. Timesheet functionality for recording daily tasks and hours.
Line Manager permissions assigned through Role Management. Determines which users can approve leave requests and access manager-level leave views.

Sick leave requests trigger integration with online doctor platform for teleconsultation booking. Doctor conducts video consultation and determines SLC eligibility. HAH platform issues official DHA certificate.

Notifications sent to approvers for pending leave requests. Payroll processor receives email notification when unpaid leave deductions are created or scheduled for future months. Notifications for closed payroll months that cannot receive new deductions.

Public holiday dates stored in Holiday Calendar. Modifications trigger automatic recalculation of leave days for current and future cycles. Holiday deductions applied to leave requests falling on modified dates.
Leave requests are submitted and managed through Time module. Calendar view displays leave requests with color-coding. Leave request status (Pending, Accepted, Rejected) is tracked in Time module.
Notifications for pending leave requests sent via Bayzat App. People Managers can manage team leave requests through mobile app Manager View. Leave request approvals can be actioned from mobile app.
Payment processing for online doctor consultation (AED 50 per session). Payment must be completed before SLC can be issued.
Official SLC issuance through DHA system via HAH platform. DHA certificates are automatically shared with employer through Bayzat platform.

Leave request reports can be downloaded in Excel format. Unpaid leave deduction reports available for employee and organizational analytics. Historical SLC records accessible for audit and compliance.
Unpaid leave requests with complex statuses block automatic removal of offboarded employees from payroll tables, preventing clean exit workflows.
Leave accrual cycles must support country-specific regulations (e.g., KSA anniversary-based accrual). Current system defaults do not accommodate local requirements.
Leave expiry notifications and salary configuration reminders require configurable notification periods and dynamic flagging mechanisms not currently supported.
Payroll templates and audit logs require visibility into leave balance modifications, partial paid leave tracking, and unpaid leave aggregation across multiple months.
Leave calculations should account for shift-based day-off configurations. System currently ignores shift scheduler settings and applies rigid workweek configurations instead.

Leave policy assignment and balance initialization depend on employee hire date and status. Changes to hire date should trigger leave cycle recalculation, particularly for individual cycle configurations.

Public holiday additions must retroactively recalculate leave deductions and trigger payroll adjustments. System also needs to account for employee-specific workweek when determining compensatory days per labor law.
Unpaid leave periods are deducted from service duration for EOS calculations per labour law. This integration is implemented but lacks clear user-facing documentation.

Employees under probation cannot request leave for the specified leave type

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Unpaid Leave Payroll Deduction Calculation Failures
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat payroll system uses a static salary reference point and fixed daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of dynamic, time-sensitive calculations. This prevents accurate prorated salary deductions based on actual leave duration and corresponding salary. Additionally, the system cannot aggregate unpaid leave days from multiple months when processed together, creating discrepancies between deduction amounts and displayed leave days. Backend API failures also occur when retrieving employee unpaid leave deductions, and the system lacks capability for retrospective salary rate calculations based on the specific month and salary configuration when leave was taken.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Configuration Locked After Employee Assignment
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform prevents modification of leave policy configurations after employees have been assigned to the policy. Administrators cannot deactivate carry-over allowances for companies with individual leave cycles, change a policy's payment type (paid/unpaid), or edit unpaid leave deductions even if payroll items have been processed. This restriction prevents corrections and adjustments to policy settings post-assignment.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Likely due to potential complex impacts on payroll calculations and End of Service (EOS) duration tracking

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Balance Data Loss on Employee Reassignment
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform lacks robust safeguards against data loss when administrators modify leave policy configurations. The system allows complete data reset when employees are unassigned and reassigned to policies, potentially erasing historical leave balances. Additionally, the system cannot recover attachments that were deleted or never successfully uploaded, with no mechanism to restore permanently deleted leave request documents.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: KSA Regulatory Compliance Gap for Sick Leave Accrual
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform currently lacks native support for KSA-specific sick leave regulations that mandate individual, anniversary-based leave accrual cycles. The system defaults to calendar year or hire date-based accrual, which does not meet local regulatory requirements for Saudi Arabia operations.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Missing Audit Trails and Reporting Visibility
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform lacks a user-accessible interface for viewing detailed audit logs of leave balance modifications. Administrators cannot easily trace manual adjustments to leave balances through the UI. Additionally, payroll templates lack the capability to track and display partial paid leave scenarios with percentage-based calculations (e.g., KSA 75% sick leave), and cannot display unpaid leave count and leave salary totals as data points, creating reporting gaps where users cannot view total unpaid days and corresponding salary implications in a single view.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Limited Policy Ordering and Disclaimer Customization
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform lacks flexible policy ordering controls in the employee view. Policies are automatically sorted by update time, which does not allow manual prioritization or pinning of critical policies like annual leave. Additionally, the system lacks flexibility in generating policy-specific disclaimer messages for conditional leave policies, with generic messages that do not adapt to nuanced pay structures, leading to potential employee misunderstandings.

The Bayzat platform lacks granular notification control, where role-based permissions automatically include notifications that may not be relevant to the specific role's core responsibilities. The payroll module lacks a dynamic notification system for identifying and flagging employees without complete salary configurations, creating potential manual intervention requirements during leave management. Additionally, the time-off management system has a fixed, non-configurable notification period for leave expiry, preventing users from customizing advance notice periods or enabling automatic notifications for line managers.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Offboarded Employees Persist in Payroll with Unpaid Leave
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform currently lacks a robust automatic removal mechanism for offboarded employees with complex leave statuses. The system cannot dynamically handle employee exit scenarios involving unpaid leave requests, leading to persistent payroll table entries that prevent clean employee removal.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Incomplete Unpaid Leave Workflow with Payroll Integration
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Bayzat platform lacks a comprehensive unpaid leave request workflow that integrates leave management with payroll deduction calculations and tracking. The system cannot automatically manage complex leave scenarios involving salary reductions and compensation tracking, and does not provide a complete end-to-end mechanism for handling unpaid leave with precise payroll deduction calculations.

The platform does not allow modification of key leave policy parameters (accrual frequency, carry-over limits, leave type classification, reduce accrued days feature) after initial policy creation. HR managers must reconfigure entire policies or request backend intervention to change simple settings, creating significant administrative friction.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Cycle Changes Cause Data Loss & Missing Recalculation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: When leave cycles are changed (individual to calendar, or hire dates are modified), the system either loses historical leave data, fails to recalculate leave balances, or lacks a rollback mechanism to recover from unintended policy changes. Employees may be unassigned from policies without warning, and historical balance data cannot be recovered.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Calculation Ignores Shift Schedules & Missing Balance Initialization
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot dynamically adjust leave calculations based on shift scheduler day-off configurations or employee-specific workweek patterns. Additionally, leave balances fail to initialize when policies are configured before an employee's hire date, particularly for inactive employees. The system rigidly applies assigned workweek settings, ignoring actual shift schedules.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Payroll & Time Off Module Synchronization Gap
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules. Approved unpaid leave requests are not automatically linked to payroll deductions, and when public holidays are added after leave requests are submitted, the system cannot retroactively recalculate daily wage deductions. This creates manual reconciliation requirements and inconsistent financial processing.

The platform restricts leave request creation to full-day or half-day increments (no hourly leave support), prevents retroactive leave requests for periods before policy assignment, cannot consolidate leave salary requests split across cycles, and lacks automated validation for leave request timing relative to employee absence history. Managers must manually enforce time-range policies through individual profile review.

The platform has compliance limitations with regional labor law requirements: (1) Automatic leave proration based on hire date conflicts with UAE law requirements for maternity and sick leave full entitlements; (2) Cannot automatically adjust public holidays based on employee workweek configuration, preventing KSA labor law compliance for compensatory days when public holidays fall on weekends; (3) EOS calculation deduction of unpaid leave from service duration was implemented over a year ago but lacks clear user-facing documentation.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: EOS deduction feature was intentionally implemented per labour law requirements. Proration and public holiday handling appear to be unintended compliance gaps.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks user-accessible documentation on how different leave policy types (one-time vs. accrual) handle balance carry-over behavior, creating confusion among both support staff and users. Additionally, there is no audit trail visible to administrators or employees for leave policy modifications; support teams must investigate backend databases to determine when and how policies were changed.

The platform cannot selectively exclude specific leave periods from job tenure calculations. This rigid approach prevents HR managers from accurately representing complex employment scenarios involving extended unpaid leaves or specialized absence arrangements, limiting flexibility in how service duration is computed.
